EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheat raises her right hand, which glows with the power of her Shar-given magic from the incurable wound in her palm - a black sphere of sharran magic, balanced above the wound. (Same as how it appeared on UUID 80fe690a-0c7e-9292-5888-9d49e6de3e58 of SHA_NightsongsFate_OM_Shadowheart_AOM_OOM_COM). Shadowheart looks defiant, powerful. Awed murmurs can be heard from the assembled Sharrans.The last of Viconia's followers shuffle away from her. Viconia looks at them with disgust before turning her attention back to Shadowheart.
EditorData.SFXTags: [AK] Shadowheart conjures a black sphere of sharran magic Followed by awed murmurs from the assembled Sharrans
EditorData.VFXTags: [AK] Shadowheart conjures a black sphere of sharran magic, the same kind seen in SHA_NightsongsFate_OM_Shadowheart_AOM_OOM_COM.

Text.Value: They already heard how you disgraced yourself before Lady Shar. How she marked you as the enemy. But it is quite another thing for them to see it for themselves.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Viconia awaits SH. A sharran audience in the wings murmurs their disgust as SH appears

Text.Value: You were right about one thing. Lady Shar's church does need to be cleansed - of you. And by my hand.
You always were too inquisitive for your own good - no matter how much I disciplined you. Very well - one little indulgence, before you face your reckoning.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cruel smirk. 'Fine, I'll humour you briefly.'

Text.Value: Whispers reached my ears from all corners - potential rivals of Lady Shar, all vying for the same prize. A new god, amassing the disaffected, the outcasts - those who should turn to us.

EditorData.NodeContext: Note of anger at the end - the Absolute is encrouching on her goddess's territory

Text.Value: You sent us against the Absolute? The githyanki? It was a suicide mission from the start.
No. Lady Shar has chosen me to cleanse her ranks - you no longer have her blessing.
You sent us against the Absolute? The githyanki? It was a suicide mission from the start.
So let the others fight, while we wait. Once they are spent and bloodied from each other, we would slip in and take the prize. Alas, all perished. All but you.
Do you hear these delusions? She defies my command. She thinks she knows better - she thinks she is better. But you will soon learn otherwise, girl.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Watching sharrans react with disquiet, murmuring amongst themselves.
EditorData.NodeContext: First section directed at onlooking Sharrans, last line directed at shadowheart

Text.Value: I thought you might try to flee, rather than face us. Perhaps you are braver than I thought - or more arrogant than even I can fathom.
I must keep her faith alive in mortal hearts. I must defend her ways, lead her children, stop all threats. Even if I must go against her wishes, I will prove myself her most loyal servant.

EditorData.NodeContext: Self-righteous

Text.Value: Tell the onlookers of the powers that Lady Shar has gifted you. Either they join you or face oblivion.
No matter. I built this place from nothing - I can always start anew once you've been dealt with.

EditorData.NodeContext: Defiant.

Text.Value: And do not be so foolish as to attack me again. Unlike before, I am flesh and blood - but am very well protected.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cautioning - reference to how the player attacked an illusion of Viconia earlier while not aware it wasn't actually her.

Text.Value: You will not prevail here. But you may survive - if you give me the artefact.
I survived the Gauntlet of Shar. I sacrificed Selne's own daughter. I am your rightful leader.

EditorData.NodeContext: Addressing all the onlooking Shar followers in the hall

Text.Value: I shall stand with you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: A group of sharrans move to Shadowheart's back.
EditorData.NodeContext: Swearing fealty (having just changed sides to support the player)

Text.Value: Why do you even want the artefact so badly? Tell me the truth, at least this once.
The threat of the Absolute is upon you all - and Viconia is not fit to lead you!
I had to act. I had to strangle that foul conspiracy while it was still in the cradle.

EditorData.NodeContext: Impassioned, verging on fanaticism

Text.Value: Tell me one thing at least, before we end this - why did you want the artefact?
I survived the Gauntlet of Shar. I sacrificed Selne's own daughter. I am your rightful leader.
A true Sharran like you must be on the right side.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The sharrans' murmurs grow more animated. One shouts out in support.
EditorData.NodeContext: Supportive, swayed by the player's argument
EditorData.SFXTags: [AK] positive murmurs from the assembled Sharrans. One shouts out in support.

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You wear the armour of a Dark Justiciar

Text.Value: I survived the Gauntlet of Shar. I sacrificed Selne's own daughter. I am your rightful leader.
We learned all we could - the artefact was the one thing the Absolutists feared. The one thing they desperately wanted to keep out of their enemies' grasp. I had to have it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Impassioned, verging on fanaticism

Text.Value: Always a pleasure to see old acquaintances. But you would be wise to not interfere in this matter.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little bittersweet, before hardening into a warning. Addressed to Minsc and/or Jaheira (old companions of hers from earlier games, shocked to see her again).

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You wear the armour of a Dark Justiciar

Text.Value: Urge the onlookers to heed Lady Shar - she speaks to you. She has chosen you.
You've finally found yourself a following, Mother Superior. And you only had to hollow out their heads to do it.
You're acting against Shar. She'll damn you as quickly as she damned me.

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You wear the armour of a Dark Justiciar

Text.Value: I walked through the depths of Lady Shar's darkness, where others feared to venture. I am favoured.
I've heard enough.
I walked through the depths of Lady Shar's darkness, where others feared to venture. I am favoured.
Urge the onlookers to heed Lady Shar - she speaks to you. She has chosen you.
Lady Shar didn't ask you to do this. You betrayed her - pursued your own goals.
It seems none answer your call.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The onlooking Sharrans are unimpressed - none join Shadowheart's side. Viconia smiles and speaks to them.
EditorData.NodeContext: Taunting
EditorData.SFXTags: [AK] negative murmurs from the assembled Sharrans

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You wear the armour of a Dark Justiciar

Text.Value: Tell the onlookers of the powers that Lady Shar has gifted you. Either they join you or face oblivion.
Attack.
I survived the Gauntlet of Shar. I sacrificed Selne's own daughter. I am your rightful leader.
Show the holdouts the power that Lady Shar has blessed you with.
Nonsense. Ravings. You've strayed, girl - you've failed Lady Shar's mission and allowed ambition to rot your mind.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Watching sharrans react with disquiet, murmuring amongst themselves.

Text.Value: Now, do not be so foolish as to attack me. Unlike before, I am flesh and blood - but am very well protected.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cautioning - reference to how the player attacked an illusion of Viconia earlier while not aware it wasn't actually her.

Text.Value: The traitors' ranks swell - much like a corpse left under the sun. I will take joy in making each and every one of you suffer.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Another group of Sharrans break from the fold and side with Shadowheart. There is perhaps now an even split between the two. Viconia lambasts those who changed sides.
EditorData.SFXTags: [AK] positive murmurs from the assembled Sharrans.

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You are a Dark Justiciar, and wear the armour of one

Text.Value: Urge the onlookers to heed Lady Shar - she speaks to you. She has chosen you.
Lady Shar is a goddess... she can afford to ignore that which does not threaten her.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hint of tension between her and her goddess. Their goals aren't aligned

Text.Value: You sent us against the Absolute? The githyanki? It was a suicide mission from the start.
But perhaps I can make a case for some small measure of mercy. Give me the artefact, and I can at least make this quick.
It seems your gambit is failing, girl. It would have been better if you had stayed away, stayed hidden.
So be it. A traitor's end awaits you all. These are the desperate lies of trapped vermin, nothing more. You are moon-sick, girl. A true lunatic.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Viconia watches angrily as some followers change sides, then decries them and shadowheart to all assembled.
EditorData.NodeContext: First part (up to 'awaits you all') addressed to Sharrans who have abandoned her. Middle (up to 'nothing more' addressed to her remaining supporters. Last part directed at shadowheart.

Text.Value: Tell the onlookers of the powers that Lady Shar has gifted you. Either they join you or face oblivion.
Attack.

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You are a Dark Justiciar, and wear the armour of one

Text.Value: I walked through the depths of Lady Shar's darkness, where others feared to venture. I am favoured.
But please, continue - dig your own grave. It shall make for a fine lesson to all gathered before us.
Then answer me - where is the artefact?
I walked through the depths of Lady Shar's darkness, where others feared to venture. I am favoured.
You've heard enough. Show the holdouts the power that Lady Shar has blessed you with.

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You are a Dark Justiciar, and wear the armour of one

Text.Value: I survived the Gauntlet of Shar. I sacrificed Selne's own daughter. I am your rightful leader.
Enough talk, girl. The sooner we finish this, the sooner your blood can be sluiced off Lady Shar's sacred Grotto.
But the mission was our best chance - to fight so many foes openly could prove unwise. Shar's children are better deployed as daggers in the shadows, not massed upon a battlefield.
No. Lady Shar has chosen me to cleanse her ranks - you no longer have her blessing.
You speak as though your life was not already forfeit. All that you are belongs to the Dark Lady, and in the end, she will take it all back. The only question is when.
No matter. You are here now, to face the Dark Lady's judgement, before a gathering of your peers. Give the artefact, and perhaps we will be merciful.
The artefact. Now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Ultimatum

Text.Value: The artefact is too powerful for you. The mission cannot be fulfilled. Lady Shar wishes for me to take your place.
I am very glad you decided to return. A cautionary tale such as yours will be studied by Lady Shar's initiates for years to come.

RollAdvantageReason.Value: You are a Dark Justiciar, and wear the armour of one

Text.Value: Tell the onlookers of the powers that Lady Shar has gifted you. Either they join you or face oblivion.
I've heard enough.
Attack.
This 'Absolute' is but an upstart; disturbing the natural order and threatening to impede the glorious return of Lady Shar's pure, endless darkness.
Urge the onlookers to heed Lady Shar - she speaks to you. She has chosen you.
Why do you even want the artefact so badly? Tell me the truth, at least this once.
*You knew it would come to this. Yet still, your heart races: Viconia DeVir. Your mentor. Onetime mother figure. And now, your foe.*

EditorData.NodeContext: Vy-cone-eeh-ah De-Veer

Text.Value: Pin your eyes to the treacherous she-drow. Do not focus on the many, many others - Boo will handle them.
This is your family. And now you have turned your back on it.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Raised eyebrow in reaction to what SH just said. Small sweep of her right hand at the general surrounds.
EditorData.NodeContext: Raised eyebrow to betray a little surprise that Shadowheart is aware her parents are alive. Small sweep of her right hand at the general surrounds. Referring to the onlooking Shar worshippers

Text.Value: You'll surrender it soon enough, once your last breath escapes you.
L'il Alurl! For Shar!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attack
EditorData.NodeContext: Battle cry. l-ill allure

Text.Value: L'il Alurl! For Shar!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Viconia gestures for her followers to attack
EditorData.NodeContext: Battle cry. l-ill allure

Text.Value: No. It will never be yours.
The Absolute will be dealt with. As soon as I prise the artefact from your cold fingers.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The onlooking Sharrans are unimpressed - none join Shadowheart's side. Viconia smiles and speaks to them.
EditorData.SFXTags: [AK] negative murmurs from the assembled Sharrans

Text.Value: Lady Shar didn't ask you to do this. You betrayed her - pursued your own goals.
I don't answer to you. Not anymore. I'm here for my family.
I don't answer to you. Not anymore. I'm here for my family.

Synopsis: Shadowheart confronts Viconia about her past and potentially the leadership of the cult itself. Alternatively, she may just seek to fight her former mistress in order to free her parents, should she know they're alive.
